column4: hello i have an intel video adapter in a emachine intel  82945G.GZ I would like to get the 32 bit opengl components installed and working...the people at winehq tells me this is the problem with running a game...anyone know how to go about it?
Intel graphics card in 9.04?
yes 9.04 jaunty...sorry didnt address you ;-)
uh?
yes I am using 9.04 jaunty on this machine and its an intel 82945G/GZ video card how do i get the opengl 32 bit components working so the Last Choas will work on wine?
I don't know about that, but I do know that Intel graphics cards  can get right problems with 9.04, does yours work  properly otherwise?
yes it seems to work fine for them except that it wont run the wine games (which they need in order to make the switch from windows)
there are also commercial verisons of Wine that yes are meant to be paid for,  that sometimes games work better in
Which game is it?
2D or 3D?
hmm
I haven't tried it personally for 3D gaming, but  Virtualbox 3.0+  have  support for Direct3D 8 or whatever, so maybe it will work in that
they tell me in winehq its an opengl problem
of course they need enough RAM to  run a Windows virtual machine
There are also some pretty good native games for Linux, people just need to know about them
Dual booting for only one game,  isn't that bad really,  as long as Windows is secure enough as well of course, if Internet connected
try Virtualbox I suppouse
or ask in #vbox if that game will  maybe work in there
I am not sure if there is anything for Ubuntu, but Mandriva another Linux distro has in built parantel controls
A file can be edited though so  not all websites can be accessed, but I don't know how to do that
yep that file
